results.title: Study Patterns Pt.1 (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Study Patterns”.
Encourages students to think about and improve their methods of study. Skills discussed are basic skills; reading skills; writing skills; listening skills; participation skills; examination skills and practical skills.

results.title: Study of a 2,100 year old corpse
results.brief_description: In 1972 a Chinese archaeological dig excavated the tomb of a woman who had been buried for 2,100 years. The body was so well preserved that many different scientific teams were requested to dissect and examine it to determine what it could reveal about ancient Chinese civilisation. With English commentary and subtitles.

results.title: Study Method
results.brief_description: This “How to Study” guide explores in detail problems students have in studying. Study techniques and their application are examined from both the Educational and Psychological aspects. Includes: effective reading, note taking and study organisation, setting targets and handling anxiety and stress (includes demonstration of relaxation techniques).

results.title: Study is not a dirty word
results.brief_description: Shows how to develop effective study techniques. Covers efficient notetaking; improved memory of new information through better listening, reading and notes; the necessity to relate all information to a central idea; and the motivation to do it. No other credits available.

results.title: Studs Terkel's Chicago
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
Studs Terkel, a resident of Chicago since his childhood, proudly displays the city and its ‘ethnic parade’. The ‘parade’ takes us on a view of Picasso’s statue, of Louis Sullivan’s skyscrapers, on a ride on the ‘El’ and a visit to the ‘Loop’. Terkel also takes us to the Chicago River, the Art Institute, Lincoln Park, Maxwell Street and finally, into the ethnic areas decorated by proud people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions

results.title: Studio and Location
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Photography: an introduction”.
Profiles three Australian photographers - Jacqui Henshaw, Adrian Van Valen and John Gollings. Concentrating on fashion, architectural and car photography, they discuss the differences between shooting on location and in the studio with each context having its own advantages and limitations.

results.title: Students in Berlin
results.brief_description: Shows the Free University of West Berlin and students from all over the world in part-time jobs in the city and at their studies. The history of the Free University, from its establishment by the students themselves to its present prosperous condition, with many fine buildings, numerous research institutes and large self-governing student body.
